title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.B: EVIDENCE BASED COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT FOR BEHAVIOUR AND SOCIAL CHANGE F

description.narrative: Output 6.2 : Improved evidence based community engagement for behaviour and social change interventions addressing priority practices effectively implemented, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Adolescent girls and boys, mothers and fathers, and community leaders in 106 districts adopt 11 key life-saving, care and protective behaviours for children and women

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.2 : Improved evidence based community engagement for behaviour and social change interventions addressing prioritypractices effectively implemented

description.narrative: The three-phase COVID 19 RCCE mixed-approach strategy to keep populations engaged in the response, reached 16.5 million people (92% of the planned target) through mass media interventions, while over 10 million people including children were engaged through interpersonal communication activities, implemented based on COVID safety and prevention measures. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2021
